content.description: Soft granite with big holds at the bottom, slightly overhanging.
content.location: On left most side of Boulder follow jugs off ground to pockets and pinches to top out.

content.description: Still a little bit of debris towards top of climb. Lots of angled holds that can only be used in specific ways, a few are heinous as well. Super technical.
content.protection: As of now, Just TR off of the two trees at the top, Or bring a crash pad.
content.location: Route starts on good right-hand rail on mid-to-right part of the Boulder. Above the bulge on the ground. Go straight up until half-way then tread left to go straight up again.

content.description: A 25' tall boulder that lays on the West side of Sabino Canyon Pkwy. It is the wall right next to the road, literally. Hard technical granite with dicey moves up a steep face.    As of now only two routes have been cleaned off of the boulder. Expect a fair amount of debris on other parts of the boulder. The Boulder is East facing and is in the shade by early afternoon.    There are two Pines at the top that are usable for Top Roping any part of the boulder. Belay/spotter will be standing in the road, but it is currently closed for construction and does not recieve much traffic anyways.
